sentences.en: Basing himself on the realities of his life, the painter successfully integrated realism and artistic exaggeration.
sentences.cn: 画家根据自己的现实生活, 成功地把现实主义和艺术夸张结合起来.

sentences.en: Both realism and naturalism are mimetic systems or practices of representation.
sentences.cn: 现实主义和自然主义都是一种模仿体系或表现性的做法。

sentences.en: Children can get frustrated when they are unable to achieve realism in their drawings.
sentences.cn: 如果孩子们在绘画中表现不出真实性,他们就会变得灰心丧气.

sentences.en: Clever lighting and sound effects brought greater realism to the play.
sentences.cn: 巧妙的灯光和音响效果给这出戏注入了更强的现实主义色彩.

sentences.en: Greene's stories had an edge of realism that made it easy to forget they were fiction.
sentences.cn: 格林的小说带有现实主义色彩，很容易让人忘记它们是虚构的。

sentences.en: Greene's stories had an edge of realism.
sentences.cn: 格林的小说有强烈的现实主义色彩。

sentences.en: I hate to interject a note of realism, but we don't have any money to do any of this.
sentences.cn: 我不想插话讲实际情况, 但我们确实没钱做这些事.

sentences.en: It was time now to show more political realism.
sentences.cn: 现在是拿出更多政治务实精神的时候了。
现实主义, 简洁精练, 刺激感官,充满美感和魔力.

sentences.en: The 2012 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Mo Yan"who with hallucinatory realism merges folk tales, history and the contemporary".
sentences.cn: 2012年诺贝尔文学奖得主为莫言，他“很好地将魔幻现实与民间故事、历史与当代结合在一起”。

sentences.en: The early ambitions of youthful enthusiasm soon become tempered with realism.
sentences.cn: 之前年少时对理想抱负怀有的一腔热情很快便被现实浇灭。
那部电影的逼真的现实主义

sentences.en: The president of the Republic oscillated between a certain audacity and a prudent realism.
sentences.cn: 该共和国总统施政风格时而大胆冒进，时而谨慎务实。

sentences.en: the realism of the horses on the carousel
sentences.cn: 旋转木马上各个木马的逼真形态

sentences.en: the tough realism of his early works
sentences.cn: 他早期作品粗粝的现实主义风格

sentences.en: There was a new mood of realism among the leaders at the peace talks.
sentences.cn: 参加和平谈判的领导人之间有着一种务实的新气氛。

sentences.en: This return to realism has produced a revival of interest in a number of artists.
sentences.cn: 这种重回现实主义的趋势已经重新激起了人们对许多艺术家的兴趣。

trans.tran_cn: （文艺的）现实主义，现实主义的态度和行为，<哲>唯实论，实在论
trans.tran_en: the style of art and literature in which things, especially unpleasant things, are shown or described as they really are in life
